DOC.detailed_description: The primary aim study ass effectiveness high low intensity , disease management program nicotine dependence . In study , recruit 750 smoker 20 rural , primary care clinic Kansas . Subjects randomly assign one three study arm , provide 20 month treatment : C ( comparison group ) , LDM ( low-intensity disease management ) HDM ( high-intensity disease management ) . Participants group C receive health educational mailing offer free nicotine replacement therapy ( six week ) bupropion ( seven week ) every 6 month ( month 0 , 6 , 12 , 18 ) . Participants LDM receive intervention C plus low-intensity disease management program include single telephone counsel session use motivational interviewing ( MI ) month 0 , 6 , 12 , 18 encourage cessation attempt also include coordination smoking assessment pharmacotherapy patient 's physician . HDM participant receive C plus high intensity disease management program include six telephone-based MI counseling session month 0 , 6 , 12 , 18 encourage smoking cessation attempt prevent relapse quit attempt , well coordination smoking assessment , quit attempt , pharmacotherapy patient 's physician . The primary outcome study 7-day point prevalence abstinence cigarettes 2 year enrollment . Secondary outcome include : 1 ) number quit attempt 2 ) progress stage change . If successful , intervention provide generalizable model address nicotine dependence could improve long-term management smoking primary care .
